SENT.plain: Congenital bicuspid aortic valve, one of the most common congenital heart abnormalities, may become infected, may calcify, and may cause progressive stenosis or progressive insufficiency
While no previous reports suggested cerebral emboli in the absence of valvular infection, we studied four such cases
In all, cerebral angiography was normal and no extracardiac source of emboli was demonstrated
Microthrombus formation and valvular thickening with incompetence could eventuate in embolization
